Basic HTML Structure

Refer to the readings from September 11 on the class calendar for more.

<!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html>
<head>
  <title>title</title>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="PATH_TO_STYLESHEET">
</head>
<body>
  All content
</body>
</html>

Block Level HTML Elements

The elements we use to break our content into sections for layout. Your other content should probably be nested in one of these. Refer to the readings from September 28 on the class calendar for more.

<header>
<nav>
<footer>
<div> (always use an id or class attribute)

CSS Selectors

Read more on the Mozilla Developer's Network

  • tag
  • #id
  • .class

CSS Box Model Properties

The box model properties control how block style elements are displayed. We use them to size elements, draw borders around them, and control how they are spaced. Click each element for documentation

  • padding: space between the content and the border
  • border: the line around the edge of the element
  • margin: the space outside the border
  • width: the size of the element's content
